topic.title: Moving from DVR deployments to non_DVR

section.title: Moving from DVR deployments to non_DVR
section.p:
If you have an older deployment of which is using DVR as a default and you are attempting to move to non_DVR, make sure you follow these steps:
Remove all your existing DVR routers and their workloads. Make sure to remove interfaces, floating ips and gateways, if applicable. neutron router-interface-delete <router-name> <subnet-name>/<subnet-id> neutron floatingip-disassociate <floatingip-id> <private-port-id> neutron router-gateway-clear <router-name> <ext-net-name>/<ext-net-id>
Then delete the router. neutron router-delete <router-name>
Before you create any non_DVR router make sure that l3-agents and metadata-agents are not running in any compute host. You can run the command neutron agent-list to see if there are any neutron-l3-agent running in any compute-host in your deployment.
You must disable neutron-l3-agent and neutron-metadata-agent on every compute host by running the following commands: $ neutron agent-list +--------------------------------------+----------------------+--------------------------+-------------------+-------+----------------+---------------------------+ | id | agent_type | host | availability_zone | alive | admin_state_up | binary | +--------------------------------------+----------------------+--------------------------+-------------------+-------+----------------+---------------------------+ | 208f6aea-3d45-4b89-bf42-f45a51b05f29 | Loadbalancerv2 agent | helion-cp1-comp0001-mgmt | | :-) | True | neutron-lbaasv2-agent | | 810f0ae7-63aa-4ee3-952d-69837b4b2fe4 | L3 agent | helion-cp1-comp0001-mgmt | nova | :-) | True | neutron-l3-agent | | 89ac17ba-2f43-428a-98fa-b3698646543d | Metadata agent | helion-cp1-comp0001-mgmt | | :-) | True | neutron-metadata-agent | | f602edce-1d2a-4c8a-ba56-fa41103d4e17 | Open vSwitch agent | helion-cp1-comp0001-mgmt | | :-) | True | neutron-openvswitch-agent | ... +--------------------------------------+----------------------+--------------------------+-------------------+-------+----------------+---------------------------+
$ neutron agent-update 810f0ae7-63aa-4ee3-952d-69837b4b2fe4 --admin-state-down Updated agent: 810f0ae7-63aa-4ee3-952d-69837b4b2fe4
$ neutron agent-update 89ac17ba-2f43-428a-98fa-b3698646543d --admin-state-down Updated agent: 89ac17ba-2f43-428a-98fa-b3698646543d Only L3 and Metadata agents were disabled.
Once L3 and metadata neutron agents are stopped, follow steps 1 through 7 in the document and then run the neutron-reconfigure.yml playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts neutron-reconfigure.yml
